definition: history book
surname Shi
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Some records, make up the history books of the palace.
sentences.chinese: 有些记载，弥补了史书之阙。

sentences.english: However, the most unforgettable in the history books still.
sentences.chinese: 不过，最令我难忘的还是史书。

sentences.english: Sometimes there are multiple official history of the same dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 有时一个朝代甚至会有多部官方史书。

sentences.english: History does not relate whether the priest gave him absolution .
sentences.chinese: 史书上没有记载是否神父宽恕了他。

sentences.english: General Mirror for the Aid of Government is the first historical annals in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 《资治通鉴》是我国第一部编年体史书。

sentences.english: Our country the first composed the Chronicles history "age".
sentences.chinese: 编撰了我国第一部编年体史书《春秋》。

sentences.english: NO02, The history books are on the top shelf of this bookcase.
sentences.chinese: 历史书籍在这个书柜的上层。

sentences.english: Besides histories, we have many volumes of reminiscences, and biograph ies with number.
sentences.chinese: 除了历史书籍外，我们还有不计其数的回忆录和传记。

sentences.english: The history book recorded the details of the vicissitude of times.
sentences.chinese: 这本史书详细地记述了时代的变迁。

sentences.english: The fourth part analyses original view about the compiling of the history book.
sentences.chinese: 分析郑樵关于史书编纂的别识心裁。

sentences.english: There are different opinions on Confucious exact birthday in the historical records.
sentences.chinese: 关于孔子的生辰，史书的记载存在着分歧。

sentences.english: Historical records, Emperor Ming Yingzong thanks to the pro-temple name "Ten Thousand Buddhas Monastery."
sentences.chinese: 史书记载明朝英宗皇帝亲赐寺名“万佛禅寺”。

sentences.english: Peng Chu industrious hands with earth-shattering volume history books.
sentences.chinese: 用勤劳的双手捧出一卷惊天动地的史书。

sentences.english: Some of them are from history books, but most are from famous novels.
sentences.chinese: 它们有些来源于史书记载，但大部分来源于著名小说。

sentences.english: History books often seem to be invested with an air of unreality.
sentences.chinese: 史书似乎常带有一种不真实的味道。

sentences.english: There are hundreds of other histories about dynasties and emperors.
sentences.chinese: 中国有几百本在皇帝和王朝支持下编纂而成的史书。

definition: the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
historical records
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
historical biography
scribe/court recorder/historian/historiographer
to write down/to record/written account

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls
historical material or data

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
History of the Sui Dynasty, thirteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Wei Zheng 魏徵|魏征[Wei4 Zheng1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 85 scrolls
historian
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
History of the Ming Dynasty, twenty fourth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Zhang Tingyu 張廷玉|张廷玉[Zhang1 Ting2 yu4] in 1739 during the Qing Dynasty, 332 scrolls
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
